result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sebastian Cortez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sebastian Cortez appeared by video.  
Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Sebastian Cortez.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling  Conference. 
Defense request a resolution hearing.  
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
Parties advised this hearing will be held via zoom.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  LAS, NMW and Co- actors: Garbriel Perez  and Arias Cortes.

Defendant Sebastian Cortez in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM.   Case calendared for an Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  
Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. 
Court ordered case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

for No Contact Order, for warded to the Judge. 
Initial Appearance scheduled 8-15-2022.

Per email correspondence with Atty Johnson  requesting defendant to appear via due for his Initial Appearance due to a medical condition,
Granted by the Court.  Intial Appearance scheduled August 15, 2022 at 8:30am- via zoom.
Commissioner Roth adjourned the matter for 11/8/22 at 1:30pm due to medical issues and unable to appear in person.
Initial appearance on August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court Commissioner Roth read the letter from the treatment facility and granted the court date to be rescheduled for 90 days. Court date for 5/23/2022 has been vacated. Notice has been mailed out.
Letter from Lakeview Specialty Hospital & Rehab indicating that the defendant is an in-patient at their facility and will be unable to physically appear for their May 23, 2022 hearing.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/23/2022@1:30p
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
